Name: Disqualifying previously expelled council members from receiving public campaign financing.
Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to disqualifying previously expelled council members from receiving public campaign financing

History.Description: This Introduction was Introduced by Council
This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Governmental Operations

Summary: This bill would disqualify any candidate who is running for a position as a member of the City Council from receiving public campaign funds if the candidate was previously expelled from the City Council.
Text:
Be it enacted by the Council as follows:
      
      
      Section 1. Subdivision 1 of section 3-703 of the administrative code of the city of New York is amended by adding a new paragraph (p), to read as follows: 
       (p) if a candidate for member of the city council in a primary, special, or general election, must not have been previously expelled from the city council.
      ï¿½ 2. This local law takes effect immediately.
